<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FileOutputBuffer - This interface provides simple way to create an in-memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// buffer which will be written to a file. During the lifetime of these</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// objects, the content or existence of the specified file is undefined. That</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is, creating an OutputBuffer for a file may immediately remove the file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If the FileOutputBuffer is committed, the target file&#39;s content will become</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the buffer content at the time of the commit.  If the FileOutputBuffer is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// not committed, the file will be deleted in the FileOutputBuffer destructor.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#a92df6484e65e47b575a10a4f2080ae1b">FileOutputBuffer</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Set the &#39;x&#39; bit on the resulting file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#af1b284b267d7f4e6bac7b2e2f5916543afe6cf01b015c486f72450c8dee965b43"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#af1b284b267d7f4e6bac7b2e2f5916543afe6cf01b015c486f72450c8dee965b43">F&#95;executable</a> = 1,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Don&#39;t use mmap and instead write an in-memory buffer to a file when this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// buffer is closed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#af1b284b267d7f4e6bac7b2e2f5916543a689301246a0b57930b400d09c64c2efa"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#af1b284b267d7f4e6bac7b2e2f5916543a689301246a0b57930b400d09c64c2efa">F&#95;no&#95;mmap</a> = 2,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Factory method to create an OutputBuffer object which manages a read/write</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// buffer of the specified size. When committed, the buffer will be written</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to the file at the specified path.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When F&#95;modify is specified and \\p FilePath refers to an existing on-disk</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// file \\p Size may be set to -1, in which case the entire file is used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Otherwise, the file shrinks or grows as necessary based on the value of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p Size.  It is an error to specify F&#95;modify and Size=-1 if \\p FilePath</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// does not exist.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;FileOutputBuffer&gt;</a>&gt;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Flushes the content of the buffer to its file and deallocates the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// buffer.  If commit() is not called before this object&#39;s destructor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is called, the file is deleted in the destructor. The optional parameter</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is used if it turns out you want the file size to be smaller than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// initially requested.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#aafb077585b21cdc78ea9bdd1c0624228"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#aafb077585b21cdc78ea9bdd1c0624228">commit</a>() = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If this object was previously committed, the destructor just deletes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// this object.  If this object was not committed, the destructor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// deallocates the buffer and the target file is never written.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#a4f000f4de53568b0618c9271ba71ce01"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer/#a4f000f4de53568b0618c9271ba71ce01">~FileOutputBuffer</a>() = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">default</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This removes the temporary file (unless it already was committed)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// but keeps the memory mapping alive.</span></CodeLine>
